result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrance T Fletcher

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court by zoom video for Terrance T Fletcher.  Terrance Fletcher not in court in custody.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
for No Contact with DGF, JMN, KS, signed and filed
Defendant to have no contact with DGF, JMN, KS
forwarded to court for review

Defense counsel to receive discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.   Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. *Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.

Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT and Attorney Ritter is appointed by the SPD office.

Defendant Terrance T Fletcher in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Alex Geocaris for Pat Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in custody. 
Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed doctor report and do not contest findings. State, defense and defendant waive right to hearing. Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.
signed and filed

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court, defendant Terrance T Fletcher not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
OFF THE RECORD:  Matter scheduled for Competency Hearing. Defense counsel requests additional time to review report with defendant and requests doctor report return date.  Case adjourned, Br. 25.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
received and filed
Competency hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Terrance T Fletcher in court with Attorney Amanda M. Parent, appearing as a friend of the court.  Defendant Terrance T Fletcher in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Parties in court to review the doctor's report.
State is not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.
Defense counsel advises Court that defendant is challenging the findings of the doctor's report.
Futher, defense counsel advises Court she will follow-up as to appointment of counsel for the next court date.

Court orders case adjourned for competency hearing in Branch 28.

Forensics confirmed Dr. Goebel's availability for the next court date.

Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.

Order for Competency Evaluation, Signed and forwarded to Forensic Unit
For competency evaluation.

Defendant Terrance T Fletcher in court via zoom and with F 2 attorney Haley Wentz.  Defendant Terrance T Fletcher in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Patrick J. Anderson. Parties have reviewed the report submitted by Dr. Goebel.  Defense is requesting an additional Dr. Report.  Court ordered case adjourned for return on Dr. Report in Br 28.  mn  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
from Jenna Goebel, Psy.D., dated May 4, 2022 - received
for no contact forwarded to court for review
Order for competency examination signed and filed.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Defendant Terrance T Fletcher in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Terrance T Fletcher in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Terrance T Fletcher appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
